posts.post_content: How does being an artifact protect you from infection again...?
posts.html:
How does being an artifact protect you from infection again...?

Posted By: Ninjakraken (4/30/2011 3:31:54 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
... You don't use it instead, you use it with [Liquimetal Coating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liquimetal Coating)  
  
If you are using LIquidmetal and don't have [Shimmer Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shimmer Myr) in play, they know exactly what you can do. This gives you an element of surprise.  
  
Oh, so you want to try to [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) my [Indomitable Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Indomitable Archangel) when I have 2 artifacts out, huh? Well, Argent Mutation, it fizzles!  
  
Also, it draws a card. In the situation I gave, thats good card advantage right there.
posts.html:

Posted By: Mode (7/14/2011 5:23:03 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The squished-up art does not do justice to this card's flavour.  
  
Karn is basically turning some random Phyrexian into a shiny statue, which works well with the flavour, since he realizes he can't heal his world, he can only hinder Phyrexia's progress.  
  
The card itself could work well if it is combined with some artifact destruction, and even many cards in Standard which interact with artifacts, or to quickly get a particular Metalcraft engine going, while keeping card advantage.  
  
Certainly not the best for any one of its abilities, but it gets the job done where it is needed.
posts.html:
The squished-up art does not do justice to this card's flavour.

Karn is basically turning some random Phyrexian into a shiny statue, which works well with the flavour, since he realizes he can't heal his world, he can only hinder Phyrexia's progress.

The card itself could work well if it is combined with some artifact destruction, and even many cards in Standard which interact with artifacts, or to quickly get a particular Metalcraft engine going, while keeping card advantage.

Certainly not the best for any one of its abilities, but it gets the job done where it is needed.

posts.post_content: @DoragonShinzui - The flavour text does tie into the card. Karn was travelling to help stop the spread of the Phyrexian taint (a poison/disease-like affliction); by transmuting something into an artifact, he hoped to hold the taint at bay...but it failed.

posts.post_content:
Normally there's some sort of correlation between a card's function and flavor text. At least a vague connection.
  
This has none. It does nothing but enable combos, really, and even then there are better options.
  
A rather pitiful card. No wonder the Mirrans lost.

Posted By: DoragonShinzui (3/29/2012 9:27:35 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
In conjunction with [Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas)'s -1 ability you can turn any mundane permanent into a 5/5 threat.  
  
Fun cards to use with this:  
[Master Thief](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Master Thief)  
[Metallic Mastery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Metallic Mastery)  
[Divine Offering](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divine Offering)  
[Revoke Existence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Revoke Existence)  
  
Also, any time you have the "draw a card" function on a spell, even if it seems pointless, it is a huge advantage.
posts.html:
In conjunction with Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas's -1 ability you can turn any mundane permanent into a 5/5 threat.

Fun cards to use with this:
Master Thief
Metallic Mastery
Divine Offering
Revoke Existence

Also, any time you have the "draw a card" function on a spell, even if it seems pointless, it is a huge advantage.
